name: overmedicated
text: GOD I love Cropes.

name: saint
text: Pete reminds me of my uncle. the only real difference is that Pete is safely tucked in the internet and my uncle is in the next room.

name: luckypyjamas
text: that kind of made me shudder

name: drskradley
text: Indeed.  I felt an instant shudder.

name: tim_simmons
text: it should be a button, like a chubby or a lame. 'a shudder for you, good friend'

name: saint
text: it's funny because Beef is quivering in your avatar.

name: tangles
text: nervous laughter here

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Not saying Onstadt dropped the ball, but rather than the ego assertion of "you want someone to die", Pete would seem like a fatalist- "someone is marked to die. Or destined." something like that.
But, what do I know?

name: gigs
text:
Yes, but then it loses the whole 'It's really all up to Nice Pete in the end, but it's also not, because it's just something that happens when he wants something to die'. He is the direct cause of death, but he takes it not to be directly his actions, just a natural order of things.

Talking about being marked or destined for death is abit more cliche than that, y'know?

name: shinkusan
text: Nice Pete is like Santa Claus, with one difference: He stop at nothing to kill you.

name: griffypoo
text: So exactly like Santa Claus, then?

name: shinkusan
text: Yes. Exactly like Santa Claus.

name: spinynorman
text: Nice Pete's mouth is like a golden hole for the creepiest shit you ever heard.

name: cailetshadow
text: I was tempted for a moment to paste your comment into google and see what it turned up. But then I wasn't anymore.

name: pdg
text:
The words "golden" and "hole" should never be uttered together in the same sentance. Ever.
Chubby for the creep factor.

name: spinynorman
text: Ray used it to describe Cornelius in one of the blogs about naming the pub, I believe.

name: mikeleffel2
text: I think Nice Pete is a lot like what a Roast Beef could turn out to be, under different 'circumstances'.

name: deimosrising
text: Pete could never be fired in any crucible save the hills of West Virginia. It is a unique ferment, unimaginable to outsiders.

name: lizjones
text: As a West Virginia native, I resemble your comment.

name: deimosrising
text: Whereabouts are you from? I was born in Charleston, but I've lived in Parkersburg and Morgantown too.

name: lizjones
text: Nice! I was born in Parkersburg, actually. But I moved to Massachusetts when I was five, so I don't think I got the full WVA experience.

name: tragicone
text: I know a girl or two from Morgantown.

name: epicurus
text: I spent quite a while trying to get the text from this one to fit legibly on an MSN avatar. It's one of my most-used.

name: alejandroadam
text: this says to me that nice pete is crazy as hell, but completely reasonable

name: invidious
text: I like to think that Pete is confessing to having worked at IBM in that first panel. Based on his personality this would answer soooo many technical questions I have about computers.

name: boredom_man
text: IBM-Deutchland, circa 1941.

name: a_dude
text: classic nice pete.

name: havenless
text: Theres something really creepy about that last panel. Not only what he says but also the way his eyes seem bigger.

name: syrinx
text: This strip was partially responsible for a metal song I wrote one time.  My band never played it live, but it was fun.

name: zeroasalimit
text: Stop being a tease, record it and upload it. :)

name: syrinx
text: I just don't feel like it's the right thing to do.  It was a pretty bad song.

name: zeroasalimit
text: It's your call man, but art is art, there isn't really bad stuff or good stuff.

name: mikekitchell
text: actually, there is such thing as really bad art.

name: afkpuz
text: People only really realize this after they've used the internet.

name: heccibiggs
text: A comment left by heccibiggs was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by salvagebar, 762, Crater12, colorlessness)

name: tekende
text: From out of nowhere, a huge slam on metal music

name: bixschmix
text: The obvious conclusion is, make it good. Then record it and post it here. Just make sure it doesn't sound like the Cure.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Nice Pete has inspired me in metal writing too!  I am inserting the declaration "I am the death sound" into a song I'm currently working on recording.  It's gonna be rad.

name: perhapsmaybe
text: the eyes! THE EYES!

name: wharfrat
text: hmm, im from a place called oak park, and they have a hill...

name: nurdbot
text: If you've lasted that long with Nice Pete, you know he's saving you for something 'special'. He's got a bag of quicklime with yo' name it!

name: closefriend
text: The fact that Pat deserves this magnitude of scare makes it even better.

name: dougthehead
text: Given Nice Pete's views on killin', it's surprising Pat has been able to live with him this long.  Pat seems like the kind of person everyone wants to kill after he's said about three sentences.

name: wae
text: it seems plausible that, deep down, pat is just as un-hinged as pete. or that they are both extremely-hinged, but in the same un-hinged way.

name: deusoma
text: I get the impression that, faced with a psychotic murderer, Pat restrains himself a bit.

name: heccibiggs
text:
AAAHHH YOU HAVE VIEWED 1337 STRIPS.

Lame me as you will, I'm not going to lie about how genuinely excited this makes me.

name: atmus
text: It's gets better after 30,000 more.

name: origotoshi
text: And now: Him - 1668, You - 1667.

name: pepperhittherim
text:
I will never, ever in my life get tired of the Nice Pete story arc.
Also, Pat's face in the second to last panel is worth taking a second or third look at.

name: drskradley
text: At least he sees it as special.  Too many don't.  Pete does not approve of random killing.

name: cameasiam
text: This arc is f-f-fukkin great!

name: deancain29
text: It's a special thing you do

name: waddlerz
text: Last Panel close-up makes this strip-5!

name: toiletstore
text: Murder has never been explained with such grace

name: cailetshadow
text:
don't move pat.
he can't see you if you don't move!

name: cormanosanchez
text: I imagine Pete slowly kneeling over to Pat and saying his last line fairly quietly while a really good minimalist movie score plays.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i meant to hit 'reply', not 'chubby' so you have that for you.

i think of it as a two-note pickup into a small acoustic piece. a montage of dissolving clips with the two working in the jailyard, eating in the mess hall and sitting on their beds, mouths always moving, talking, getting to know each other, piece ending with a fade into the next strip.

name: anzio
text: So, a fairly standard transition of time deal.

name: deovalente
text: Rarely do you see Nice Pete's facial expression change.  I picture him with a constantly blank look on his face, speaking in a pause-less monotone.

name: changuitotuerto
text: Pat's lower lip in panel 8

name: laserblade
text: Onstad has hit a rich, rich vein.

name: snowman
text: Pat's mouth reactions are awesome here.

name: spectre
text: Killing should not be casual. It should be *SPECIAL*, and if that someone you want to kill is not really a special person to you, then you should wait and kill someone else later.

name: gmm
text: Possibly my all time favourite

name: crankheart
text: i can't stop myself from 5ing all of the strips where nice pete makes an appearance. wtf is wrong w/ me?

name: bixschmix
text: cropesaphilia

name: narm
text: The three panels of Pat doing nothing but reacting are genius.

name: pursesnatcher
text: test

name: mustakrakesh
text: He's such a nice...Pete.

name: fattypneumonia
text: Murder, Explained - starring Angela Lansbury

name: riotdejaneiro
text: I love this arc. It is pure gold.gold...gold

name: dusty
text: I think the reason he doesn't kill pat is because pat is enough of an asshole to be a real person, not a floating ball of light with hair, a sack of bugs in a costume, or a forgotten sin waiting for you to show a moment of weakness. But he is not enough of an asshole to warrant killing him despite his being a person.
